title: Ticket #619: Write compatibility functions for conversion from old to new ClassAds
description:
To ease the proposed transition from old to new ClassAds, we want to write compatibility functions for methods that exist in old ClassAds but not new ClassAds. The current list of functions to be written is at ClassAdConversionTodo.

The code for the ClassAds conversion is on branch V7_3-new_classads-branch in git. The compatibility methods are implemented in a child class of classad::ClassAd called compat_classad::ClassAd. The code is in src/condor_c++_util/compat_classad.cpp/h.
remarks:
2009-Jul-13 15:21:21 by mccardel:
A few questions that I'm placing in here in case anyone either knows the answers or if I forget them later:

1) The current EvalString methods first check to see if the Target is themselves, then does something if that is the case. If the function hasn't returned after that, it'll make a MatchClassAd called `mad`. This MatchClassAd doesn't seem to be used, but there is a function call to "EvaluateAttrString(...)" right below its creation. It seems like this should be "mad.EvaluateAttrString(...)", since there's no reason to create the MatchClassAd if you aren't going to use it. Does anyone know the correct behaviour?

2) The function sPrintExpr takes in a char* buffer. The buffer is set during the function, but it is also returned. The documentation for it mentions that it returns FALSE if the named expression can not be found in the classad, TRUE otherwise, so it seems like at one point it returned a boolean. Should I update the docs or rewrite the function to return booleans?

2009-Jul-21 10:59:09 by mccardel:
Status update:

All the functions from blocks #1 and #2 but ClassAd::put(), ClassAd::initFromStream(), and ClassAd::GetReferences() are done (but not tested).

That leaves just those three, ExprTree::Eval() and the stringList*() functions to do. As well as thorough testing.

2009-Aug-03 13:29:49 by mccardel:
Status update time! I've been spending most of the past week(s) testing and rewriting.

The following functions are done and tested: sPrintExpr, IsValidAttrValue, fPrintAsXML, ChainCollapse, EvalString(...,char *), EvalString(..., MyString&), and NextDirtyExpr.

The function EscapeStringValue is done and tested, but needs some call-site changes.

The function initFromStream() is done and needs testing (not sure how to do that one).

The function put() is mostly done, and mostly tested. I need to figure out how invisible attrs work, and how they'll "work" in compat classads.

To thoroughly test the put() and initFromStream() functions, I'm thinking of setting up a system where those functions are used instead of the normal ones, and seeing what breaks. The main other way I can think of testing these is by crafting my own Stream object and trying to test with that pre-made Stream, but I'm not sure how to go about creating a Stream just for that. If anyone knows how, get in touch!

We need to change the call-sites of SetDirtyFlag (as outlined in its page), as well as GetDirtyFlag and CopyAttribute.

I still need to write all the stringListFoo() functions (and figure out what's the analogous use for them in new classads!). These shouldn't take too long I don't think. Just need to figure out a few things and it'll be easy from there.

I also need to write and test ExprTree::EvalTree() and ClassAd::GetInternalReferences(). Other than glancing at the code and deciding to put these off til the last (so I'd have a better understanding of the code), I haven't done much with these.

2009-Aug-10 11:52:32 by mccardel:
Did some further testing and fixed a few functions. Added support for invisible attributes to put(). Rewrote the code for put() so we didn't have two Mostly Identical functions, but now just one function that takes in a bool to decide if we need to do special things with regard to MyType and TargetType.

I believe I have GetInternalReferences working. I haven't tested it yet, and before that I want to look over it one more time to make sure it follows the "when a reference is internal" rules. GetExternalReferences also has a version that takes in a PortReference, but I haven't written an Internal version of that since I'm not certain we'd need it. Should be a fast addition if the need arises.

I'm in the process of writing ExprTree::EvalTree(). I still have to write the stringListFoo() functions, and I still have to figure out what they're used for and how to emulate them. edit: the stringListFoo() functions appear to have already been written. They're in fnCall.cpp.

2009-Aug-27 09:54:06 by mccardel:
The stringlistFOO functions were in the file fnCall.cpp in the new classad's directory, so I did not write those.

EvalTree is 99.999% done, and I just need to double check that my interpretation of wording is correct.

GetInternalReferences has been written, tested, rewritten, and tested again. It appears to be working, but I want to do a little more testing before I'm certain.
